subject: Learning
title: Reflection: The Missing Habit
description: A quick win: understand Reflection: The Missing Habit.

hook.text: You finish studying and immediately move on. You never asked: what did I actually learn today?

buildup.text: Reflection is the most neglected phase of learning. Students rush from task to task without processing.

discovery.text: A call center study found that workers who reflected 15 minutes daily outperformed those who worked 15 minutes more.

twist.text: Reflection doesn't require sophistication. Three questions suffice: What worked? What didn't? What will I change?

climax.text: Over time, reflection builds metacognitive habits that operate automaticallyâ€”making you a smarter learner.

punchline.text: Fifteen minutes of reflection beats fifteen minutes of more work.

quiz.question: What did research find about workers who reflected 15 minutes daily?
options: They outperformed those who spent that time working instead
They performed the same as workers who didn't reflect
Reflection only helped managers, not regular workers
